mods.abstract: TWENTY DOLLARS REWARD. RANAWAY on Friday last the negress LUCY, or LUCINDA, formerly belonging to Capt Kelley, then to Mrs. Twogood, and afterwards to Mrs. Clark, in Poydras street. She is about 25 years of age, abovo 5 feet high, stout and well made, very healthy, and very much disposed to laugh. She had on when she went, a red flowered calico frock. She was seen on Saturday evening on the Levee, at the foot of Girod street, neatly dressed. Captains of steamboats, are warned against receiving this runaway on board. The above reward will be paid by the subscriber for her delivery either in his hands, at the corner of Tchopitoulas and Natchez sts; or in any Jail in the state. H BONNABEL. m28
mods.accessCondition: Please submit an LSU Special Collections reference ticket at https://askus.lib.lsu.edu/special for any questions or comments about this digital object.

Physical rights are retained by the LSU Libraries. Copyright has expired and the item is therefore in the public domain. Permission to reproduce this image must be requested through the Special Collections Department, Louisiana State University Libraries.
mods.note: Louisiana Runaway Slave Advertisements, 1836-1865, Louisiana Digital Library, Baton Rouge, La.
